page.title: 01BRITISH RAIL DERBY
page.content: There are{850 staff}who run the station and organise the trains.{198 {trains}pass through Derby station every day, that is{1,208}train movements each week,{620,816}each year.The average passenger train has {10 coaches}each of which can carry{45 people.Local passenger-diesel trains have a speed limit of 75mph.High speed Inter-city trains have a 90mph.speed maximum although they can travel at 125mph. Only{50 freight trains}pass through Derby each week.Freight trains can travel at 75mph.and may pull{40 {wagons. Derby station,built in 1840 and enlarged in 1890,is now being partly re-built at a cost of{Â£3,500,000.
